Node.definition: = a type of song (שִׁיר) probably to be accompanied by musical instruments
= man; ◄ son of Jesse (יִשַׁי) ► king of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל)
= causative action by which humans or deities cause information that is stored in someone else's mind to be reprocessed by speaking about it
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= process by which humans or deities respond with anger to a situation in which (other) humans have disobeyed an order or broken a law
literally: to judge; hence: = action by which humans or deities inflict a penalty on others as retribution for what they have done
= state in which humans and deities experience excitement ◄ caused by anger

= action by which humans or deities respond to negative behavior of (other) humans by administering some sort of punishment, which may range from a verbal rebuke to physical correction, ► often done with corrective intent, but sometimes also as retribution

= pointed missile, shot from a bow; slender and straight in shape and moving swiftly; ◄ made out of wood and/or iron; ► mainly used for hunting, in warfare, and occasionally for divination; ≈ symbol of aggression, affliction, and punishment
literally: hand; hence: = process by which humans or deties engage in an act of violence against (other) humans

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant
= part of the body that is healthy and unaffected by a sickness or other affliction
= the soft substance in the body of humans and animals that consists of muscle tissue and fat
= action by which humans or deities express their intense anger; ◄ caused by someone else's behavior, ► almost invariably resulting in punishment for the party that is responsible

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant
literally: bones; hence: = the physical body of a human being
= action by which a human being commits a wrongful act against God or someone else, whether on purpose or not, ► which may require atonement, restitution, and/or retribution
= a deed of deliberate wrongdoing resulting in a state of guilt which requires punishment

= upper part of the human body, or the front or upper part of the body of an animal, typically separated from the rest of the body by a neck, and containing the brain, mouth, and sense organs; ≈ associated with the entire person, that person's life, and that person's responsibilities
= state in which an object has relatively much weight, ≈ which is often associated with slowness, functioning with difficulty, but also with importance, riches, status, etc.

Node.gloss: to be heavy|to be serious|to be grievous|to be burdensome|to be strong
Node.definition: = state in which an event is weighing heavily on the mind of those undergoing it
= process by which objects such as dead animals, plants, or wounds give off a foul odor; ≈ considered repulsive
= process by which wounds or parts of the human body decompose
= area of physical damage on the body; ◄ caused by sickness or aggression; ≈ sometimes used in a figurative sense to refer to difficult circumstances
= state of being regarded as foolish, ◄ because of lack of fear of God, unwillingness to listen to advice, talking too much, and being unable to conceal one's temper
= state in which humans are bowed down ◄ either because of sickness or as a result of deep sorrow, distress, or fear
= state in which an event takes place with a strong intensity
literally: all the day; hence: = process by which an event or pattern of events takes place for an extended time, without interruption

exact meaning unsure: = action by which humans put on dark and/or dusty clothes; or: to wear a dark and gloomy expression on their face; ◄ caused by grief as a result of the death of a loved one, ill health, oppression, suffering, or compassion for someone else's suffering; ► in order to make it publicly known that one is mourning
= action by which humans, deities, or animals move through an area without a specific destination
= area of the body located on both sides of the spine between the ribs the the hip; location where fat can accumulate
= state or process by which a location is dominated by a certain event, to the extent that it dominates everything else, ◄ as if it were completely filled with that event

= causative action by which humans expose other humans to the heat of fire; ► which will result in excessive suffering and/or death; ≈ also used in a more figurative sense for the burning sensation caused by high fever

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant
= part of the body that is healthy and unaffected by a sickness or other affliction
= the soft substance in the body of humans and animals that consists of muscle tissue and fat
literally: to crush; hence: = causative action by which someone causes someone else to suffer harm and humiliation, ◄ which feels as if having been crushed with a heavy object
= state in which an event takes place with a strong intensity
= action by which animals, humans, or deities produce a full, deep, prolonged sound as made by a lion; ≈ associated with aggression, but also with suffering
= action by which humans make a deep inarticulate sound ◄ caused by pain, grief, or severe suffering
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
originally a plural construct with first person singular suffix of אָדֹון (אָדֹון) = way of addressing God as master and lord
= state in which humans experience a desire to see something happen or do something oneself; ◄ this desire is associated with one's heart (לֵב) or throat (נֶפֶשׁ) ≈ and can be both good and evil
= act by which humans make a deep inarticulate sound ◄ caused by pain, grief, or severe suffering
= state in which certain information is not generally known, ◄ as if it were physically hidden

= the organ located in the centre of the human body that pumps the blood through our circulatory system, ≈ seen as the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
= process by which the heart beats faster than normal; ≈ associated with anxiety and fear
= action by which humans or deities move away from an object, person, or place
= state in which humans, animals or deities have the ability to perform actions, or to prevail in, or endure situations that require the exertion or mustering of effort or force

= light as a physical phenomenon, mainly observed during daytime, and the opposite of darkness; ◄ one of God's most important attributes; first created by God and since produced by sun, moon, and stars, but also by fire; ► enables people and animals to see; ≈ associated with life, goodness, happiness, prosperity, security, favor, and wisdom, loved by the righteous, and hated by the wicked

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices

Node.gloss: also|too|even|moreover|what is more|what is worse|furthermore|besides|both … and
Node.definition: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant
particle linking two entities and denoting that X and Y function as one single entity in the proposition in focus
= person to which one directs one's feelings of affection
= someone with whom a person has some level of association, for example, by geography, social or ethnic grouping, personal connection, or temporary circumstance
= a disease or sickness or wound ◄ caused by another person or sent from God or a deity ► to punish a person or nation for some wrong or disobedience
= action by which deities, humans, or animals make an intensive effort to locate (other) humans, animals, objects, or activities, which often requires them to move from one location to another

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood
= causative action by which humans make an effort to ensure that a certain event takes place
= state of hardship or difficulty in a circumstance, sometimes as the consequence of wicked behavior

= action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually not directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= process by which events take place that cause damage, distress, hurt, and/or loss of life
literally: all the day; hence: = process by which an event or pattern of events takes place for an extended time, without interruption
= action by which humans utter words with the focus on what is said
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
= state in which humans or animals are unable to perceive with the ears
= state in which humans or animals are unable to speak ◄ because of a physical limitation or because of emotions
= action by which humans or animals open their mouth ► in order to speak
= an opening in the lower part of the face of humans and animals through which food and air are taken and vocal sounds are emitted
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant
= an opening in the lower part of the face of humans and animals through which food and air are taken and vocal sounds are emitted
= action by which someone speaks in order to defend oneself or to accuse someone else; sometimes accompanied by actions
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= referent to a male participant that is addressed in a discourse
= action in which humans or deities respond to a question or situation, either by words or by actions
originally a plural construct with first person singular suffix of אָדֹון (אָדֹון) = way of addressing God as master and lord
plural with singular meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= state in which humans and deities feel and show great joy
= state in which an object is not firmly fixed to the surface on which it stands so that it can move or slip; to waver
literally: foot; hence: = pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life

Node.gloss: to make oneself great|to show one's greatness|to magnify oneself
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities show others their elevated status, which they have, either in their own eyes or in the eyes of other people, ≈ which can either be good or bad, depending on whether this status is justified
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
= state in which humans or objects are ready for a particular activity
= state in which humans are physically wounded
= a deed of deliberate wrongdoing resulting in a state of guilt which requires punishment

Node.gloss: to fear|to worry|to be anxious|to be afraid|to be distressed
Node.definition: = state in which humans experience fear, anxiety, or distress ◄ out of uncertainty of what might happen to themselves or their beloved ones; ► which may express itself in trembling and shaking of the body
= action by which a human being commits a wrongful act against God or someone else, whether on purpose or not, ► which may require atonement, restitution, and/or retribution
= person who has a conflict with someone else and acts accordingly

Node.gloss: to be healthy|to be strong|to be vigorous
Node.definition: = state in which humans are in a good physical condition
= state in which humans are numerous and therefore potentially powerful
= process by which people, objects, and events increase in number or frequency
= person who experiences hostily towards someone else and acts accordingly
literally: falsely; hence: = process by which actions are taken without any justifying motivation
= state in which an event is morally and/or ethically wrong, resulting in a state of guilt and, eventually, hardship and suffering
= state in which events are well performed, morally and ethically correct, and beneficial to others
= action by which animals, humans, or deities suspend their commitment to (other) objects, animals, humans, or deities, either temporarily or permanently
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
plural with singular meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations
= action by which someone performs an event quickly
= action by which humans or deities provide assistance or support to (other) humans (in both military and non military contexts) ► in order to make their life or work or task easier
originally a plural construct with first person singular suffix of אָדֹון (אָדֹון) = way of addressing God as master and lord
= causative action by which humans or deities come to the rescue of humans in need
